intro: Sedum dasyphyllum subsp. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, narrow leaves that are typically green or bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it an attractive choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
